Package parser

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • parser.Parser
  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Recursive Descent Parser class that takes a list of tokens from lexer and parses them, converting them into appropriate abstract syntax tree nodes.
    Author:
    Berlian K

        public void parse()
        Parses statements in statementList until end of the token list has been reached.

      • parseStmt

        private Stmt parseStmt()
        Method that checks if a token is a statement token and and sends it to the corresponding parse method if it is. If not it moves to the next parsing method
        Returns:
        A statement tree node

      • checkEnd

        private boolean checkEnd()
        Method for checking if end of token list has been reached
        Returns:
        true if end of file is reached, false if not yet end of file

      • next

        private void next()
        Moves to next token in token list

      • consume

        private Token consume​(TokenType tokenType)
        This method checks if a parsed token matches an expected token. If it does it is consumed, and the parser moves to the next token to be parsed. If not then the program is missing a token and a parser error is thrown
        Parameters:
        Expected - token type
        Returns:
        consumed token
        Throws:
        ParserError - if current token is not expected token

      • match

        private boolean match​(TokenType... types)
        method that checks if current token matches a particular token type. If it does, that token will be parsed, and parser will move to the next token. Unlike Consume() does not throw an error if current token is not expected token.
        Parameters:
        Expected - token type
        Returns:
        boolean depending on if current token matches expected token
